#  ![Logo alt](images/logo.png)

### License Forms

![](images/license_img.png)

#### Agriculture Department

  * Application for the Grant of Licence to Sell, Stock or Exhibit for Sale or Distribute Insecticides (Form-VI)



Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every citizen | Fee according to Rule 10 (2) Through Treasury Challan | 

  * Affidavit for Enhance Fee 
  * Situation of the Dealer's premises where the insecticide will be stored/ sold
  * Qualification Proof
  * Principal Certificate of Firm 

| Subject Matter Specialist of Agriculture Development Block | [Fillable PDF](pdfs/Agriculture/Pesticide/03 Application for the grant of license to sell stock or exhibit for sale or distribute insecticide.pdf)  
  
  * Application to Obtain Dealer Licence (Form-A)



Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every citizen Form in Duplicate  |  Fee of renewable is Rs. 20/- After Licence Expiry within one month the license will be renewed on additional Fees Rs. 25/- Through Treasury Challan | 

  * Photograph of the applicant duly attested by the concerned Officer of The District/ Block
  * Applicant’s PAN No. and Proof of Permanent Residence
  * Affidavit on Stamp Paper attested by the Notary/ 1st Class Magistrate
  * Affidavit for responsible Person under Seed Act duly attested by Notary/ 1st Class Magistrate
  * Principal Certificate/ source Certificate from whom/ where the seed is obtained
  * Side MAP of Store/Godown duly verified by the concern SMS/ ADO/ AEO
  * List of Dealers
  * Copy of Partnership Deed
  * Memorandum of Company
  * Inspection Report of Seed Inspector 

| Subject Matter Specialist of Agriculture Development Block | [ Fillable PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/SEED/02 Application for renewal of license to carry on the business of a dealer in seeds.pdf)

Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every citizen Form- A in Duplicate | Rs. 50/- Through Treasury Challan | 

  * Photograph of the applicant duly attested by the concerned Officer of The District/ Block
  * Applicant’s PAN No. and Proof of Permanent Residence
  * Affidavit on Stamp Paper attested by the Notary/ 1st Class Magistrate.
  * Affidavit for responsible Person under Seed Act duly attested by Notary/ 1st Class Magistrate
  * Principal Certificate/ source Certificate from whom/ where the seed is obtained
  * Side MAP of Store/Godown duly verified by the concern SMS/ ADO/ AEO
  * List of Dealers
  * Copy of Partnership Deed
  * Memorandum of Company
  * Inspection Report of Seed Inspector

| Subject Matter Specialist of Agriculture Development Block | [ Fillable PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/SEED/02 Application for renewal of license to carry on the business of a dealer in seeds.pdf)

Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every citizen | Fee according to Rule 10 (2) Through Treasury Challan | 

  * Affidavit for Enhance Fee
  * Situation of the Dealer's premises where the insecticide will be stored/ sold
  * Qualification Proof
  * Principal Certificate of Firm

Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every Citizen | Rs. 1000/- grade | 

  * Project Report.
  * Affidavit of responsible person / Nodal Officer. 
  * Partnership deed/ MOA Company.
  * Set up of Laboratory/ Vertification Laboratory equipments.
  * SSI registration.

Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
B.Sc. Agriculture/ B.Sc with Chemistry/ Diploma in agriculture from recognized University Govt., Institute/ Certificate course of fifteen days from any State Agriculture University or Krishi Vigyan Kendras or National Institute of Agricultural Extension Management (MANAGE) OR National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj (NIDPR) OR Fertilizer Association of India or any other approval Govt. Institute. | Rs. 500/- online e-challan  | 

  * O Form.
  * Map of Godown.
  * NOC from Society/ Panchayat

| SMS (Agr.) at Concerned Block | [ PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/20-GrantOfFertilizerLicenceRenewal.pdf)

Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every Citizen | Rs. 2250/- | 

  * O Form.
  * Map of Godown/ Rent agreement. 
  * Affidavit of responsible person.li>
  * Partnership deed/ MOA Company.
  * Quality Control Reports. 
  * Price tag of fertilizers to be sold.
  * Power of Attorney of authorized Signatory.
  * Sale returen for last 3 years to quality report (in case of renewal).

| Joint Director of Agriculture | [ PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/20A-Forms.pdf)  
  
  * Grant of Insecticide License



Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every Citizen | Rs. 2000/- per Insecticide or maximum Twenty thousand through online/e-Challan | 

  * Application in form III/IV for grant/renewal of insecticides manufacturing license.
  * Self-attested copies of Registration certificate issued by CIB&RC for addition of new products. 
  * Affidavit from MD/Director/Partner/Sole Proprietior regarding appointment of person.
  * Affidavit from MD/Director/Partner/Sole Proprietor to the effect that no employee of the firm has been declared as Proclaimed.
  * Affidavit of the person responsible for the purpose of section 33 of the Insecticides Act, 1968.
  * Affidavit of the full-time expert staff
  * Self-attested copy of ‘no objection/consent for water/Air/Hazardous Waste disposal from State Pollution Control Board.
  * Inspection report/recommendation of the Inspection team.
  * Consent of the Medical Board.
  * Valid marketing agreement.
  * Affidavit from MD/Director/Partner/Sole Proprietor of the marketer company/firm regarding appointment of person.
  * Affidavit of the person of the marketer company/firm responsible for the purpose of Section 33 of the Insecticides Act, 1968.
  * Self-attested copy of the Manufacturing/sale licence of the marketer company/firm.

| Joint Director of Agricluture cum-License authority | [ PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/19-GrantOfInsecticideLicence.pdf)  
  
  * Grant of Seed License



Eligibility Criteria | Fee and Payment | Documents Required | Submit to | Download  
---|---|---|---|---  
Every Citizen | Rs. 500/- online or through e-challan | 

  * Application on Form A.
  * Original Challan after submission of application fee of Rs. 1000/-.
  * NOC from Panchayat/Cooperative Society.
  * Site plan of place of business.
  * Rent agreement; if any.
  * Two passport size photographs. 
  * Inspection Report of Seed Inspector.
  * Principal Certificate.
  * Application on Form C.

| [ PDF ](pdfs/Agriculture/21-GrantofSeedLicense.pdf)

Users can view agricultural statistics by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. One can check year wise agricultural statistics just by clicking on the provided links. Details of varieties of crops are also provided.

Get information on Farm Produce Price Policy by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture. Users can get details related to cost of production, trends in market prices, inter-crop price parity, international market price situation, effect on general price level, etc. Access to minimum support prices, wholesale prices of commercial crops, wholesale prices of non-commercial crops, farm harvest prices of principle...

The Pesticides Unit monitors the demand and availability of pesticides in states for adoption of crop protection measures. Users can get detailed information on pesticide monitoring unit, production of unit and state wise demand of pesticides.

Find the Watershed Atlas of India by the Soil and Land Use Survey of India (SLUSI). The digital atlas will provide information on spatial distribution of Water Resource Regions, Basins, Catchments, Sub Catchments and Watersheds. The atlas also provides methodological details and guidance on utilisation of atlas for locating watersheds. Users can buy the atlas by referring to the contact details provided online.

The Farmers' Portal of the Department of Agriculture, Co-operation and Farmers' Welfare is a platform for farmers to seek any information related to agriculture. Detailed information on farmers’ insurance, agricultural storage, crops, extension activities, seeds, pesticides, farm machineries, etc. is provided. Details of fertilizers, market prices, package and practices, programmes, welfare schemes are also given. Block level details related...

Details of minutes of weather watch meetings by National Crop Forecasting Centre, Department of Agriculture and Cooperation are available. Users can download documents related to forecasting of crops. Link to website of weather resource system of India is also given.

  10. ###  [Acts and Rules by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare](https://agriwelfare.gov.in/en/Acts)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Facts-and-rules-department-agriculture-and-cooperation "External Website that opens in a new window")

Get information on acts and rules provided by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture. Acts related to agricultural marketing, cooperation, drought management, horticulture, Integrated Nutrient Management, mechanization and technology, etc are available. Users can also access details act and rules related to plant protection, seed, Technology Mission on Oilseeds and Pulses, etc.

  11. ###  [National Policy for Farmers 2007 by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare](https://agriwelfare.gov.in/en/Acts)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)

Details about National Policy for Farmers 2007 by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture are given. Users can get information on policy re-orientation, recent initiatives, major policy goals, asset reforms to empower farmers, support services, special categories of farmers, etc.

       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fnatural-resource-management-schemes-department-agriculture-and-farmers-welfare "External Website that opens in a new window")

Find schemes and programmes related to Natural Resource Management by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture. Users can go through details about the schemes such as Central Sector Scheme of Soil and Land Use Survey of India (SLUSI), Central Sector Scheme of Soil Conservation Training Centre, Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC), Centrally Sponsored Programme for Reclamation and Development of Alkali and Acidic...

  13. ###  [Checklist of Commercial Varieties of Fruits by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare](http://nhb.gov.in/fruit.aspx?enc=3ZOO8K5CzcdC/Yq6HcdIxGKOMacV/BZbHqWp6Rp7+vY=)

Get access to the book Checklist of Commercial Varieties of Fruits by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture. Users can get information about fruits, commercial varieties of fruits, name of varieties, their salient features, recommended areas for growth, ecological requirements, etc. Details related to state wise recommended varieties of fruits, major fruits producing belts in India, underutilized and lesser...

  14. ###  [Handbooks of farmers by Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare](https://agriwelfare.gov.in/en/Magazine)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fhandbooks-farmers-ministry-agriculture-farmers-welfare "External Website that opens in a new window")

Find the Farmer Friendly Handbooks for various states provided by the Department of Agriculture and Cooperation, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare. The Handbook highlights information, schemes and programmes related to the farmers in the respective states. Users can get state-wise Handbook in English and other regional languages.

Information on changing role of agricultural extension, policy reforms, institutional restructuring, extension linkages, empowerment of farmers, mainstreaming women in agriculture, use of information technology in agriculture etc. is also provided.

#  Website of Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare 

  1. ###  [Website of Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare](https://agriwelfare.gov.in/)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-ministry-agriculture-farmers-welfare "External Website that opens in a new window")
       * [![Share on Twitter](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharetw.png)](http://twitter.com/share?text=Please+check+this+link%26url%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-ministry-agriculture-farmers-welfare "External Website that opens in a new window")

Information is provided about the Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare. Users can find details related to programmes and schemes related to horticulture, seeds, plant protection, etc. Information about drought management, vigilance, weather and agricultural activities is given. Reports related to various agricultural topics are also available. Information about the Department of Agriculture & Cooperation, its organisational setup and Divisions is also given. Highlights of upcoming conferences and seminars are also available.

Get contact details of employees of the Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare. Users can access information about name of the employee, designation, office address, room number, phone number, extension number, residence address, etc.

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-krishi-dss-department-agriculture-and-farmers-welfare "External Website that opens in a new window")

The architecture has been meticulously crafted to cater to the diverse needs of stakeholders across the agricultural spectrum - from individual farmers to policymakers. By bringing together a wealth of agricultural data layers and state-of-the-art tools, Krishi-DSS acts as a hub for innovation and informed decision-making.

Central Institute of Coastal Engineering for Fishery (CICEF), formerly known as Pre-Investment Survey of Fishing Harbours (PISFH).

The Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying (AH&D) renamed as Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying & Fisheries (DADF) was one of the Departments in the Ministry of Agriculture and came into existence w.e.f. 1st February 1991, by converting two divisions of the Department of Agriculture and Cooperation namely Animal Husbandry and Dairy Development into a separate Department.

  9. ###  [Pradhan Mantri Kisaan Maan-dhan Yojana](https://pmkmy.gov.in/scheme/pmkmy)

Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare has introduced a voluntary and contributory pension scheme for landholding Small & Marginal Farmers to provide them social security and a healthy and happy life after they reach their old age.

       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-pradhan-mantri-fasal-bima-yojana "External Website that opens in a new window")

Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is the government sponsored crop insurance scheme that integrates multiple stakeholders on a single platform.

Users can find information Soil Health Maps, Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare and its various functions. Details information related to the Soil Maps, Scheme Progress and Progress of Portal Entry etc. are provided. Links to related websites are also given.

ICAR-National Research Centre on Camel, Bikaner, is a Premier Research Centre of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) which is an autonomous organisation under the Department of Agricultural Research and Education, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India.

The Department of Fisheries is one of the Departments under the Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare. The Department is responsible for matters relating to formulation of policy and schemes relating to Development of Inland , Marine and Coastal Fisheries and Fishery Institutes namely Fishery Survey of India Mumbai, Central Institute of Fisheries Nautical and Engineering Training (CIFNET), Kerala, Central Institute of Coastal...

Get information about the Inland Fisheries under Department of Fisheries. Inland fisheries and aquaculture constitute the main components of the fisheries sector in India from production point of view.

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)

Integrated Pest Management (IPM) is designed to provide long-term management of pests, instead of temporarily eradicating them. The main goal of the IPM is to manage pests and the environment so as to balance costs, benefits, public health, and environmental quality. The Central Integrated Pest Management Centre in Jammu and Kashmir (CIPMCJK) is involved in activities of pest surveillance, mass multiplication and field releases of bio-...

#  Departments of Agriculture of states and Union Territories 

  1. ###  [Departments of Agriculture of states and Union Territories](https://agriwelfare.gov.in/)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fdepartments-agriculture-states-and-union-territories "External Website that opens in a new window")

The Department of Agriculture and Cooperation has provided links for the states and Union Territories' Agriculture Departments. One needs to click on the name of the state or Union Territory to access the website of its agriculture department.

Get guidelines for Integrated Development of Commercial Floriculture scheme by Department of Agriculture & Cooperation. Information about objectives of scheme, pattern of assistance, Model Floriculture Centre (MFC), etc. is given.

Information on the policy initiatives in agricultural marketing division is provided by the Department of Agriculture and Cooperation under the Ministry of Agriculture. Detailed information on the Marketing Research and Information Network (MRIN), construction of rural godowns, marketing reforms, Small Farmers Agribusiness Consortium (SFAC), strengthening of agricultural marketing infrastructure, grading and standardization, etc. is provided...

Find detailed information about commodities by Directorate of Marketing and Inspection, Department of Agriculture and Co-operation. Information is given about the commodity profiles such as manual on good agricultural marketing practices for cotton, post-harvest profile of grapes, post-harvest profile of chilli and post-harvest profile of mandarin, etc.

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Ffarmers-portal "External Website that opens in a new window")

The Farmers' Portal of the Department of Agriculture, Co-operation and Farmers' Welfare is a platform for farmers to seek any information related to agriculture. Detailed information on farmers’ insurance, agricultural storage, crops, extension activities, seeds, pesticides, farm machineries, etc. is provided. Details of fertilizers, market prices, package and practices, programmes, welfare schemes are also given. Block level details related...

Get information on Farm Produce Price Policy by Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture. Users can get details related to cost of production, trends in market prices, inter-crop price parity, international market price situation, effect on general price level, etc. Access to minimum support prices, wholesale prices of commercial crops, wholesale prices of non-commercial crops, farm harvest prices of principle...

The Pesticides Unit monitors the demand and availability of pesticides in states for adoption of crop protection measures. Users can get detailed information on pesticide monitoring unit, production of unit and state wise demand of pesticides.

The Handbook highlights information, schemes and programmes related to the farmers in the respective states. Users can get state-wise Handbook in English and other regional languages.

#  Website of Department of Animal Husbandry Dairying and Fisheries 

  1. ###  [Website of Department of Animal Husbandry Dairying and Fisheries](https://dahd.gov.in)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-department-animal-husbandry-dairying-and-fisheries-0 "External Website that opens in a new window")
       * [![Share on Twitter](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharetw.png)](http://twitter.com/share?text=Please+check+this+link%26url%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-department-animal-husbandry-dairying-and-fisheries-0 "External Website that opens in a new window")

The Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries (DADF) is responsible for issues related to livestock production, preservation, protection from disease and improvement of stocks and dairy development. Users can get detailed information on animal husbandry, dairy development and fisheries. Information is also provided on various schemes, trade, sanitary import permit, bird flu, swine flu, bull calves available for sale, etc.




# Related Links

Details about Compendium of Pig Development, Compendium of Feed & Fodder, Livestock Health and National Project for Cattle and Buffalo Breeding, etc. are available. Get details on central sectors such as Livestock census, Central Cattle Breeding Farms, Central Herd Registration Scheme, etc....

Users can get detailed information on management, processing, procurement, quality control, financial status, etc. Details of distribution and marketing are also given. Downloadable forms are also available.

Application form for registration of Dairy Plant under Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying & Fisheries (DAHD), Ministry of Agriculture.

The Union Ministry of Agriculture has four Central Poultry Development Organisations (Regional Directorate on Poultry development). Subsequently all the poultry units of the Central Government were restructured. In view of that the Central Poultry Breeding Farm Chandigarh and Regional Feed Analytical Laboratory, Chandigarh were merged and the Organisation has been re-christened as Central Poultry Development Organisastion (Northern Region),...

#  Website of Directorate of Cashewnut & Cocoa Development 

  1. ###  [Website of Directorate of Cashewnut & Cocoa Development](http://dccd.gov.in)

       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Fwebsite-directorate-cashewnut-cocoa-development "External Website that opens in a new window")

The Directorate of Cashewnut and Cocoa Development is a national agency primarily engaged in the overall development of cashew and cocoa in India. #  Farmers' Portal 

  1. ###  [Farmers' Portal](http://farmer.gov.in)

     * [Share This](javascript: void\(0\);)
       * [![Share on Facebook](/sites/all/themes/adaptivetheme/npi_adaptive/images/sharefb.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Findia.gov.in%2Ffarmers-portal "External Website that opens in a new window")

The Farmers' Portal of the Department of Agriculture, Co-operation and Farmers' Welfare is a platform for farmers to seek any information related to agriculture. Detailed information on farmers’ insurance, agricultural storage, crops, extension activities, seeds, pesticides, farm machineries, etc. is provided. Details of fertilizers, market prices, package and practices, programmes, welfare schemes are also given. Block level details related to soil fertility, storage, insurance, training, etc. are available in an interactive map. Users can also download farm friendly handbook, scheme...
